title: The new Honor System
body:
Everybody else is all excited about the change to Runes and Masteries, while I'm over here excited about the Honor changes.

I think rewarding people for Honor will help drive the community to be more positive, resulting in a more enjoyable game experience for everyone. I look forward to the specifics on this and will post again about my own experiences with it when it goes live!

[Here's the video going over these updates if you haven't seen it (though many will be posting it).](https://youtu.be/bY67yCaGdno?t=5m1s)

What are your thoughts about this?

https://i.gyazo.com/60dae3aaeeb6bf71919cf40fc9e2213e.gif

Edit: Pinned a comment with information about the system from their video.

replies.body:
Honor will be integrated much more tightly with the game.

* After the Nexus explodes a new screen will appear, where you can honor one teammate.
* Three types of Honors to choose from;
 * **Stayed Cool** - Tilt-proof, chill
 * **Great Shotcalling** - Leadership, strategy
 * **GG <3** - Team player, friendly
* When you enter the post-game lobby you'll see the honors you received
 * If you received 3+ Honors you will be recognized by the entire lobby

There will also be Honor Levels;

* You'll have a badge in your profile next to your rank
* Honor levels are gained simply by earning honor
* Negative players can decay Honor levels
* Higher Honor levels come with real benefits;
 * Key fragments now drop through the Honor System instead
 * More Honorable players earn more rewards, and can earn exclusive content

The new Honor System will be in the next PBE cycle this week!

After playing For Honor, I can tell you that the multiplayer community as a whole has very little honor.

Historically their solution was that each time you honored a particular player the 'value' of that honor was dramatically reduced for a period of time.  That allowed premades to honor each other but not farm it compared to players who play with strangers.

I would expect in the new system that you will still see the lobby recognition for 3+ honors but that it would only contribute to your honor level once every X games/weeks.

I'm a bit uncertain about the Honor's update.  While it's great to see things being updated, and it's certainly a step in the right direction, I don't really like not being able to honor the enemy team, or only being able to honor one teammate.  There are games when you will have exceptionally positive players on the enemy team, players who are perhaps managing to not give in to any sort of tilt or still managing to be cheerful and positive even though the game is not going in their favor, or players who go out of their way to give an enemy pointers on how to better play their champions.  That sort of behavior should be rewarded, and this set-up won't allow for it.  Nor will we be able to honor more than one teammate, even if the entire team deserves recognition.  

And I'm also wondering whether the honors that have been earned in the past will be removed when the new system goes live, or if they will be rolled into it.  I have to admit, I'll be really sad if all the positive honor that I worked for over the years is just tossed out.

I would also like to be able to honor more than one teammate.  As it stands I'm a heavy user of the existing honor system (which means I actually bother to use it at all) and I often honor two or three teammates in a particularly good game when everyone was being nice and working together and then not honoring for a couple of games because everyone was bickering or playing five separate solo games on the same map.

My hope would be that they allow us to accumulate points like the ARAM reroll system to honor additional teammates in addition to the one by default.  

My off the cuff system would be:
-1 point per game you honor an ally
-1 point per honor you receive
-every 5 points turns into an honor token
-spend an honor token to recognize an additional teammate
-max 6 tokens
This would let people occasionally honor a whole team or regularly honor a second player and let people who receive lots of honor give out more honor (positive feedback loop and presumably honorable people are good at recognizing honorable behavior).  Simultaneously it puts enough of a cost (to people who care about it) that people should think about whether the recipient is better than the other 19 players they didn't honor in their last 5 games to earn that honor token.

This is a brilliant idea!  I love it!  I don't usually go around asking for people to upvote things for recognition, but this is something that I really hope that Riot sees and considers.  If it's feasible to put something like this into place, I would really like to see it happen.  I've had matches where there has been a duo that was just really funny, positive and made a point of keeping the rest of the team from getting too down if a play went badly.  They've ended up on my friend's list after the matches, but I also honored them for their behavior.  

Funny you should mention ARAM, as that's actually one of the places where I use honor the most often now.  While I do give out honor in normal matches, there's something about ARAM for having a team of 5 players who are being laid back, silly and just working together.  Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose, but when you get one of those teams where everyone is just there to have fun... it's so nice to be able to honor everyone.

I agree that it's really exciting. I want to believe that this will motivate people to behave themselves. Can we discuss two things that make me nervous, though?

A) If people can't skip it, does that mean that everyone will just get lots of honor all the time? And if they CAN skip it, won't they just keep doing that?

B) Quiet players seem to not win here. I myself am pretty talkative, but I don't want chat to start blowing up ALL GAME because everyone is in a competition to get honor from everyone. I don't want this to become yet another thing for people to compete over. It's better, I suppose, that everyone compete to be nice, but there is a point where it's too much, no?

I would hope that it is skipable but at a slight time cost (15 second wait would be good) so the easiest approach is to engage with the system but you aren't forced to choose which of 4 horrific people to honor when you get stuck in one of _those_ games.

I also think that players that are quiet might get a little less but not necessarily a huge amount less if you use pings to communicate.  After all in those games where the talky people spend a bunch of time arguing with each other the quiet guy in the corner who was just focused on playing the game starts looking pretty good.

Yay! Honor release is coming soon!  I'm excited.  I feel like I've been waiting forever and I have to wait longer.

1.  The old honor system lacked transparency.  Players just didn't know where they stood with honor.
  I'm assuming that honor will show progress towards the next level of honor.  Otherwise, more levels of honor isn't necessarily an improvement.
  
2.  Linking key drops to honor is an interesting idea.  I got the impression that plenty of players reacted to improve when punishments prevented them from earning loot (when the loot system came out).  So I think that key drops with honor definitely provides a strong motivation for many players to be honorable in game.
 
3. The way they are going to present the honor selection post game is also interesting.  Although, not really necessary, I think really puts honor in the forefront of players minds post game.
 
**The real test of the honor system is going to be how it actually feels to players.**  If players feel like honor they achieve reflects their effort to be honorable, then I think we will see an improvement in players overall.  But if players don't get a sense that the system reflects their efforts to be honorable, then they are going to ignore it.  This is where I think **transparency is going to be key** and why I'm hoping players will be able to see not just the level of honor they have, but a visual of the progress they've made towards the next level.

I want **the honor system to motivate players to improve** and not simply be a different way to bestow gifts upon the already honorable.
